item.title: IHT Rendezvous: This Week in the Global Arts Guide
item.description: What’s on view this week at museums and cultural institutions around the world.
item.dc:creator: By ELISABETH HOPKINS
item.media:description: Installations by the artist Cai Guo-Qiang outside the Centro Cultural Banco do Brasil in São Paulo.

item.title: IHT Rendezvous: France Fights Racism by Outlawing ‘Race’
item.description: Parliament has voted to scrap the use of the word “race” in the country’s laws. Critics have condemned the move as an empty gesture that will do nothing to combat racism.
item.dc:creator: By HARVEY MORRIS
item.media:description: President Francois Hollande welcomed Mali's President Dioncounda Traore to the Elysee Palace on Friday.

item.title: Bombs at Mosques in Northwest Pakistan Kill 15
item.description: Bombs exploded outside two mosques on Friday, underlining the challenge of militant violence facing a new government led by Nawaz Sharif set to take power.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: $1 Million in Jewels Stolen in Cannes
item.description: The jewels, due to be lent to movie stars at the Cannes film festival, were stolen from a hotel room in the French Riviera town, a police official said.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: Jorge Rafael Videla, Argentina Military Leader in ‘Dirty War,’ Dies at 87
item.description: General Videla was serving a life sentence for abuses during a campaign of political killings and forced disappearances during Argentina’s so-called Dirty War. He was 87.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By ELIAS E. LOPEZ

item.title: Earthquake Hits Canada
item.description: A magnitude 5.1 quake struck Ottawa and was felt as far west as Toronto, but no damage was immediately reported.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Chechen Refugee Questioned in F.B.I.’s Inquiry of Bombing
item.description: F.B.I. agents investigating the Boston Marathon bombing have repeatedly questioned a former separatist fighter who says he had a passing social relationship with a bombing suspect.
item.dc:creator: By SCOTT SHANE and ELLEN BARRY

item.title: Currents: The Hidden Costs of Buying on the Cheap
item.description: Far from the rubble in a Bangladesh garment factory, customers and workers in a Brooklyn shop had little awareness about the people who stitch the $4 "Royal Cutie" T-shirts.
item.dc:creator: By ANAND GIRIDHARADAS

item.title: India Ink: Why Indian Elites Like to Call Themselves ‘Middle Class’
item.description: Policies for the so-called middle class end up benefiting the rich at the expense of the poor, the author argues.
item.dc:creator: By SAMBUDDHA MITRA MUSTAFI
item.media:description: An Internet cafe in Guwahati, Assam.

item.title: IHT Rendezvous: Scientists Agree Overwhelmingly on Global Warming. Why Doesn’t the Public Know That?
item.description: A new survey of scientific studies finds that the question of global warming’s causes are not in dispute among scientists, despite public perceptions.
item.dc:creator: By CHRISTOPHER F. SCHUETZE
item.media:description: Exhaust gas rises from a city transit bus as it passes an American flag in Los Angeles, California.

item.title: IHT Rendezvous: IHT Quick Read: May 17
item.description: Russia sends more missiles to Syria; a dreary news conference for a beleaguered President Obama; the “Beef-gate” scandal swirls in Indonesia; and David Beckham retires from soccer.
item.dc:creator: By THE INTERNATIONAL HERALD TRIBUNE
item.media:description: President Obama and Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan held a joint press conference during a rain shower in the Rose Garden of the White House in Washington on Thursday.

item.title: India Ink: A Conversation With: Cricket Board Official Niranjan R. Shah
item.description: Mr. Shah on the recent spot-fixing scandal, the state of Indian cricket and more.
item.dc:creator: By HARESH PANDYA

item.title: Soldier Gets Life Without Parole in Iraq Killings
item.description: Sgt. John Russell was sentenced on Thursday after being convicted on Monday of killing five fellow service members at a combat stress clinic in Iraq in 2009.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Russia Provides Syria With Advanced Missiles
item.description: Antiship cruise missiles could make it more difficult for the United States and its allies to impose a naval embargo, establish a no-fly zone or carry out airstrikes in support of Syria’s rebels.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

item.title: Peacekeepers in Golan Abducted but Released
item.description: Armed men broke into a United Nations outpost in a buffer zone separating Israel and Syria to kidnap the three military observers, the group’s peacekeeping chief said on Thursday.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing | Middle East: Iraq: Attacks Kill at Least 21 People
item.description: Car bombs exploded in Shiite neighborhoods of Baghdad for the second day in a row on Thursday, part of a series of attacks that left at least 21 people dead, officials said.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
item.media:description: An Iraqi soldier at the site of a car bomb attack in Baghdad's Sadr City on Thursday.

item.title: World Briefing | Asia: China: Refinery Proposal Draws Protests
item.description: More than 2,000 people in the southwestern city of Kunming unfurled banners and shouted, “Protest! Protest!” in a demonstration on Thursday against plans for a petroleum refinery.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Rebuilding of Mali Is Daunting Task, Despite Aid
item.description: Donors have pledged billions to help rebuild Mali after battles with militants, but the collapse of many institutions there has raised doubts about the effort.
item.dc:creator: By ADAM NOSSITER
item.media:description: A Malian soldier in Gao last month. Islamist militants have fled the town, but some remain in the region’s villages.

item.title: Trial on Guatemalan Civil War Carnage Leaves Out U.S. Role
item.description: The history of American support for Guatemala’s military went unacknowledged during the genocide trial of the former dictator Gen. Efraín Ríos Montt, who is most closely identified with the war’s brutality.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
item.dc:creator: By ELISABETH MALKIN
item.media:description: Gen. Efraín Ríos Montt, center, announcing the formation of a junta in 1982.

item.title: Foxconn Audit Reveals Workweek Still Too Long
item.description: Foxconn Technology has made progress toward better safety conditions, but employees are still working longer than Chinese law allows.
item.dc:creator: By VINDU GOEL
item.media:credit: Gilles Sabrie for The New York Times
item.media:description: Foxconn workers leaving the factory at the end of the day shift.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributors: Can Obama Save Turkey From a Syrian Quagmire?
item.description: The war in Syria is spilling over into Turkey and threatening a decade of economic gains — and Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s political future.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By SONER CAGAPTAY and JAMES F. JEFFREY

item.title: Pentagon Official Urges Congress to Keep Statute Allowing War on Terror Intact
item.description: A Pentagon official urged Congress not to modify the statute providing the legal basis for battling the perpetrators of 9/11.
item.dc:creator: By CHARLIE SAVAGE

item.title: Pressure of War Is Causing Syria to Break Apart
item.description: A constellation of armed groups battling to advance their own agendas is creating the outlines of separate armed fiefs, and the war’s biggest casualty appears to be the integrity of the Syrian state.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By BEN HUBBARD
item.media:description: Syrians tried to remove concrete with the help of a tractor last month to free those trapped under the rubble after an airstrike by government forces in Aleppo.

item.title: Uzbek Man in Boise Is Charged in Bomb Plot
item.description: Federal authorities arrested an Uzbek man in Boise on charges that he assisted a foreign terrorist group and possessed bomb-making materials.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

item.title: World Briefing | Europe: Greece: Teachers Abandon Strike Plan
item.description: Greek high school teachers on Thursday called off a strike after the government essentially banned it by enacting an emergency law that threatened strikers with arrest or dismissal.
item.dc:creator: By NIKI KITSANTONIS
